document_data.name: Losifan Urdo
document_data.mainbody: '''Losifan Urdo''' was a mercenary [[swashbuckler]] in [[Westgate]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite card/AD&D Trading Cards/1993|85|Losifan Urdo}}
document_data.Personality: Losifan was a handsome and fashionable man who cared about appearances and had a biting sarcastic wit.
document_data.Possessions: Losifan wore an [[enchanted]] ''+2'' set of [[Leather armor|leathers]], and was armed with a magic ''+1'' [[longsword]] as well as a [[main gauche]].
document_data.Activities: Losifan was one of the field officers of the [[Mercenaries' Guild of Westgate]]. He was responsible for discipline and training together with [[Mannin]]. Losifan was kind of a dandy.
document_data.History: Losifan hailed from a prominent [[House Urdo]] family of Westgate, and a known "black sheep" amongst the wealthy merchant family members. In his youth, Losifan was a duelist. Initially, he joined the Guild as a recruit but impressed [[Palla]] so much that she hired him permanently.
